Name: Bahari Crab
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Coast

Appears: Any Time


Description

A local crab, known to taste good with drawn butter.
Found along the coast of Bahari Bay. Also has a chance to be found when foraging shells in Bahari Bay.

Name: Brushtail Dragonfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley, Bahari Bay

Biome: Kilima Lake, Bahari Rivers, Bahari Ponds

Appears: Any Time


Description

The tail of this Dragonfly is so bright and vibrant, that some early Majiri were said to have used it as a paintbrush.
Found around the lake in Kilima, as well as rivers and ponds in Bahari Bay.

Name: Common Bark Cicada
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields, Bahari Forest

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

A common cicada.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay.

Name: Common Blue Butterfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley, Bahari Bay

Biome: Any

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

Ever resilient. Butterflies of this type can be found in almost every climate in Palia.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

Name: Common Field Cricket
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley, Bahari Bay

Biome: Kilima Fields, Bahari Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

The Common Field Cricket is a relatively common insect in Palia and can be found near Maji's Hollow, Chapaa Crossing, Whispering Banks, and around the Family Farm in Kilima Valley, as well as throughout Pulsewater Plains, amid the cliffs of Hideaway Bluffs, and outside Pavel Mines in Bahari Bay. Common Field Crickets can be caught at any time of day.

Name: Kilima Night Moth
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley, Bahari Bay

Biome: All

Appears: Evening, Night


Description

While beautiful, the Kilima Night Moth is so prevalent on hot summer nights that some consider it to be a pest. Keep away from stored cloth.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

Name: Paper Lantern Bug
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Coast, Bahari Forest

Appears: Evening, Night


Description

This bug glows as brightly as a colorful feast day lantern taking flight into the Palian night sky.
Found along the coast and in forests of Bahari bay during the evening and night.

Name: Spotted Stinkbug
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley, Bahari Bay

Biome: All

Appears: Any Time


Description

A bug known more for his strong musk than its striking colours.
Found all around Kilima and Bahari Bay.

Name: Bahari Bee
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields, Bahari Forest

Appears: Any Time


Description

A local species of bees, known to produce delicious honey.
A Bahari Bee has a 5% chance to spawn after cutting down small, medium, or large Heartwood trees in Bahari Bay during any time of day.

Name: Cerulean Cicada
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields, Bahari Forest

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

The call of this cicada is so soothing, it was said to be the inspiration for Ayana's fourth symphony.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay.

Name: Duskwing Butterfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Dragon Shrine

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

A beautiful butterfly with wings the color of dusk. Unique to the Kilima Valley.
Found around the Dragon Shrine in Kilima during the morning and day.

Name: Garden Ladybug
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

A black and red ladybug, popular for controlling garden pests.
Has a chance to be found when foraging in the fields of Bahari Bay.

Name: Garden Leafhopper
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

The Garden Leafhopper is such a delight in Palia that many children keep them as pets. They are said to bring good luck.
Found in the fields and Badruu's Farm in Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging in Kilima.

Name: Garden Mantis
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Lake

Appears: Any Time


Description

Nothing to see here. Just your garden variety mantis.

Name: Garden Millipede
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

A brown and green millipede that loves feasting on garden crops.
Found in the fields of Kilima. Also has a chance to be found when foraging in the fields of Kilima.

Name: Garden Snail
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Coast, Bahair Forest

Appears: Any Time


Description

A snail that has evolved over time to look like a leaf. Good for hiding from predators, bad for hiding from the Leafstalker Mantis.
Found along the coast and in forests of Bahari bay.

Name: Inky Dragonfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Rivers, Bahari Ponds

Appears: Any Time


Description

This stealthy Dragonfly is used as a component in various black dyes and inks.
Found around rivers and ponds in Bahari Bay.

Name: Lunar Fairy Moth
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields, Bahari Forest

Appears: Evening, Night


Description

The lunar fairy moth is said to have a very special connection to the Dragon Moon, and is said to only appear at special times during its cycle.
Found in the fields and forests of Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

Name: Proudhorned Stag Beetle
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

The horns of this stag beetle are said to resemble that of the Proudhorned Sernuk.
Has a chance to be found when mining in Kilima.

Name: Spineshell Crab
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Coast

Appears: Any Time


Description

A crab with a very spiny shell.
Found along the coast of Bahari bay.

Name: Azure Stonehopper
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

This little blue beauty has been known to camouflage itself as a shiny blue pebble.
Azure Stonehoppers can be found around the fields and mountains of south Bahari Bay, including Pulsewater Plains, Hideaway Bluffs, and outside Pavel Mines at any time of day.

Name: Bahari Glowbug
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields

Appears: Evening, Night


Description

A local species of bioluminescent fauna. Discovered by Professor Bonlin Amepongo.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

Name: Brighteye Butterfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Forest

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

Whenever you see the sun out, you can see the eyes of this intricately patterned butterfly looking around Bahari Bay.
Found in the forests of Bahari Bay during the morning and day.

Name: Firebreathing Dragonfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

This Dragonfly is notoriously difficult to catch, in part due to its fiery breath.
Found in the fields of Kilima.

Name: Golden Glory Bee
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Fields

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

A rare bee, imported from the Akwinduu province. Mead made from this bee's honey is said to be heavily consumed by the queen of the province and her family.
Has a chance to be found when chopping trees in Kilima during the morning and day.

Name: Gossamer Veil Moth
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Fields

Appears: Evening, Night


Description

The wings of this moth are so thin that some say you can see a peek of the Dragon Realm by looking through them.
Found in the fields of Kilima during the evening and night.

Name: Hairy Millipede
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Forest

Appears: Any Time


Description

A millipede with a hair growth problem.
Found in the forests of Bahari Bay.

Name: Leafstalker Mantis
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Forest

Appears: Any Time


Description

A herbivorous mantis that exclusively eats leaves.
Has a chance to be found when foraging in the forests of Bahari bay.

Name: Princess Ladybug
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Kilima Lake

Appears: Any Time


Description

A very regal looking lady bug, made popular by the children's fairytale, The Princess Who Turned Into A Ladybug.
Found around the lake in Kilima.

Name: Raspberry Beetle
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Daiya Family Farm

Appears: Night


Description

A beetle whose entire diet consists of raspberries.
Found around Badruu's Farm in Kilima.

Name: Scintillating Centipede
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields, Bahari Forest, Caves

Appears: Any Time


Description

A rare centipede with a shiny hard shell.
Has a chance to be found when mining in Bahari Bay.

Name: Spitfire Cicada
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields, Bahari Forest

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

A spirited cicada, whose bark is worse than its bite.
Found attached to trees in Bahari Bay.

Name: Spotted Mantis
additionalDetails:
Location: Kilima Valley

Biome: Dragon Shrine

Appears: Any Time


Description

A rare mantis with a beautiful set of spots.
Found around the Dragon Shrine in Kilima.

Name: Stripeshell Snail
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Coast

Appears: Evening, Night


Description

A snail with such distinctive stripes, that its shell was once used as currency among the early Majiri.
Found along the coast in Bahari Bay.

Name: Vampire Crab
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Flooded Forest

Appears: Evening, Night


Description

An invasive species of crab that sucks the life out of the local population.
Found around the Flooded Fortress in Bahari Bay during the evening and night.

Name: Ancient Amber Beetle
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Forest

Appears: Any Time


Description

One of the oldest known insect species in Palia, was said to exist in the time of humans.
Ancient Amber Beetles can be found in the Forests in north Bahari Bay, including the Flooded Steps, The Outskirts, Proudhorn Pass, the Thorny Thicket, and the Statue Garden at any time of day.
There is also a 5% chance to spawn an Ancient Amber Beetle when harvesting large or medium Sapwood trees anywhere in Bahari Bay.

Name: Fairy Mantis
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields

Appears: Any Time


Description

A mantis from early Majiri legend only recently confirmed to exist by modern entomologists. Said to have magical properties.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay.

Name: Jewelwing Dragonfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Pavel Mines

Appears: Any Time


Description

A Dragonfly with wings as bright and colorful as any precious stone.
Found near a cave entrance on a cliff in Bahari Bay.

Name: Rainbow-Tipped Butterfly
additionalDetails:
Location: Bahari Bay

Biome: Bahari Fields

Appears: Morning, Day


Description

Ancient legends say this rare butterfly got its beautiful coloring from dipping the tip of its wings in a Well of Flow.
Found in the fields of Bahari Bay during the morning and day.
